content.description: Let R be the region in the first quadrant under the graph of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mi>x</mi> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo> <mtext>2</mtext> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C8C@</annotation> </semantics> </math> for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <msqrt> <mn>6</mn> </msqrt> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BF0@</annotation> </semantics> </math> .
content.question: What is the average value of y=x / x2+2 on the interval <math> <semantics> <mtable columnalign="left"> <mtr> <mtd> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <msqrt> <mn>6</mn> </msqrt> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> <annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGceaqabeaacaaIWa GaeyizImQaamiEaiabgsMiJoaakaaabaGaaGOnaaWcbeaaaOqaaaaa aa@3C03@</annotation> </semantics> </math> ?

frqParts.text: What is the average value of y=x / x2+2 on the interval <math> <semantics> <mtable columnalign="left"> <mtr> <mtd> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <msqrt> <mn>6</mn> </msqrt> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> <annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGceaqabeaacaaIWa GaeyizImQaamiEaiabgsMiJoaakaaabaGaaGOnaaWcbeaaaOqaaaaa aa@3C03@</annotation> </semantics> </math> ?

topic.text: 8.1: Finding the Average Value of a Function on an Interval

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
